newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares up in selective market, falls ahead.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares up in selective market, falls ahead.

text.p: Danish share prices closed higher in a selectively focused market on Monday, cheered by rising bonds but dealers saw the risk of modest falls ahead as the market seemed to have run out of steam.
"I don't think we can repeat today's advances tomorrow, the market began to founder towards the end of trading so we will probably trickle down," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 1.99 point higher at 131.34 while the KFX December future put on 1.45 point to finish at 130.70 with 484 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.

Tele Danmark benefited from its announcement on Friday of a major Swiss telecoms deal in cooperation with Britain's BT, closing 11 crowns up at 306, while Danisco, its first-half 1996/97 result due Wednesday, also attracted attention , ending the day three crowns higher at 335.
Otherwise leading banks did well, Den Danske Bank and Unidanmark putting on 10 and nine crowns to finish at 450 and 298 respectively.
SAS rose two crowns to 74 amid heavily denied rumours of merger plans with its German strategic partner Lufthansa.
